solution_line_template: We can find how long the hare spends running by dividing the distance of the race by the hare's speed: {race_distance} feet / {hare_speed} feet/second = <<{race_distance}/{hare_speed}={hare_time}>>{hare_time} seconds
We can do the same for the turtle: {race_distance} feet / {turtle_speed} foot/second = <<{race_distance}/{turtle_speed}={turtle_time}>>{turtle_time} seconds

Finally, subtract the hare's run time from the turtle's run time to find the length of the head start the turtle needs: {turtle_time} seconds - {hare_time} seconds = <<{turtle_time}-{hare_time}={head_start}>>{head_start} seconds
